description: LocalHarvest farm seasonal availability data for bottom-up harvest timing validation
source: LocalHarvest.org farm listings - manually collected and parsed

citrus_orange.notes: Ships mid-October through mid-May. Legacy and heirloom varieties not available commercially.

farms.practices: Integrated pest management, naturally grown (not certified organic)

strawberry.notes: 3 million pounds harvested annually. Largest family-operated Strawberry Market in Florida.
Plant City winter strawberry season confirmed

peach.notes: Peaches sold from second week in July to beginning of September
Georgia peach belt farms confirm June-September harvest window

berry_blueberry.notes: Also black/red raspberries, blackberries, elderberries, gooseberries, tart cherries

tomato.notes: Heirloom varieties including Long Island Cheese Pumpkin, Spanish Roja Garlic

apple.notes: Ohio apple harvest confirmed Aug-Nov, 31+ varieties documented

tomato.notes: Ohio tomato harvest July-September, heirloom focus

citrus_grapefruit.notes: Texas Rio Red - 90% of Texas grapefruit production

peach.notes: 30+ varieties including freestone and clingstone types
Fire Zest early, Harvester mid-June clingstone, Loring/Red Globe/Dixieland freestone, Ouachita Gold August

pecan.notes: 6th generation orchard, San Saba 'Pecan Capital of the World'

farms.farmName: Yahweh's All Natural Farm and Garden

citrus_grapefruit.notes: Rio Grande Valley grapefruit Oct-April, Rio Red = 90% of TX production

peach.notes: Texas Hill Country peaches May-Aug, Gillespie County epicenter

pecan.notes: San Saba County 'Pecan Capital of the World', harvest Oct-Mar

apple.notes: Controlled atmosphere storage enables year-round sales

farms.notes: One of first U-pick farms on Old Mission Peninsula

cherry_tart.notes: Michigan tart cherry capital, Grand Traverse/Antrim/Leelanau epicenter

apple.notes: Michigan apples Sept-Oct, West Michigan fruit belt

berry_blueberry.notes: Michigan #1 blueberry producer, 850+ acres at Reenders alone

peach.notes: Michigan peaches August peak, SW Michigan

citrus_orange.notes: Ships direct from grove within 3-5 days

apple.notes: Heritage trees planted in 1887, no pesticides

farms.practices: Naturally grown, no pesticides or chemicals

apple.notes: Small batch processing within hours of picking

berry_blueberry.notes: U-pick available on specified summer dates

citrus_orange.notes: California citrus Nov-May, Central Valley and foothill farms

apple.notes: Sonoma County heritage apple production, Gravenstein harvests July-August

strawberry.notes: Monterey/Santa Cruz coastal strawberries, near year-round production

farms.farmName: Brick House Acres - Garden Center & Berry Farm

farms.practices: Sustainable farming, Pride of NY member

strawberry.notes: U-pick strawberries, call Berry Line for conditions

apple.notes: Hudson Valley and upstate NY apple production Aug-Nov, 50-85 varieties per orchard

strawberry.notes: NY strawberries June peak, some extended to October with everbearing

cherry.notes: Sweet cherries mid-late June, sour cherries end of June

peach.notes: Full stride mid-August, accompanied by plums

apple.notes: Late September through October, heirloom varieties available

farms.farmName: Orchard Country Produce and Fruit Farm

farms.practices: Sixth generation family fruit farm, Western PA Amish country

apple.notes: PA apples September-October, some extending to November

blueberry.notes: PA blueberries July peak, extending to August
Largest blueberry producer in Halifax County

farms.practices: Ecological growing, CSA (Durham, Chapel Hill, Carrboro, Hillsborough)

apple.notes: NC apples September-October, some starting July in Piedmont

farms.notes: Maple syrup, honey from own bees
150+ years Hall family farm, former peach packing shed
Leading producer Central Savannah River Area
Diversified farm with orchards and pasture
Oldest family-run farms in US, Hurlbut family
Oldest non-certified organic farm in AL, 20+ year CSA

blueberry.notes: 13 varieties, u-pick and pre-picked, frozen year-round

farms.notes: Base of Teton Range, serves Jackson Hole
33 acres, small orchard along Little Kanawha River
900 acre orchard & farm, U-Pick, bakery, cider mill
Small family-run, farmers markets, CSA Fruit Share
3rd generation, U-Pick since 1970, cider on premises
9 apple varieties, 14 crabapple varieties, mid-Aug to late Oct
29 acres, 2,200 apple trees, 3,500+ aronia bushes, naturally grown
Baranof Island, 100in annual rainfall, possibly smallest U-Pick in US
Alaska Pacific University project, Matanuska Valley
100 acres hay, greenhouses, vegetable gardens, berries

vegetable.notes: Long summer days, giant produce possible

phase1.goal: Proof of concept - FL, GA, WA farms

phase2.notes: Efficient batch parallel searches after optimizing collection approach. All 50 states now have farm-level seasonal availability data for harvest timing validation.
